title: Marketing Manager, Strategic Enterprise Partnerships
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Wolt is one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing tech companies, on a mission to make cities better places to live by building a platform that connects people with the best of their neighborhoods‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs food, groceries, or retail. Operating in over 25 countries, Wolt‚Äôs success is driven by a deep focus on customer experience, local relevance, and a culture that empowers people to take ownership and make an impact.

In Germany, our marketing team is made up of talented, passionate, and impact-driven professionals working across brand, growth, retention, and partnerships marketing.

This role, Marketing Manager for Strategic Enterprise Partnerships, sits at the intersection of marketing and commercial strategy. You‚Äôll define how we work with national restaurant partners from a marketing perspective‚Äîleading co-branded campaigns, shaping scalable frameworks and unlocking long-term growth for Wolt.

What you‚Äôll be doing

Location: Berlin HQ

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced marketing leader to take full ownership of our Strategic Enterprise Partnerships Marketing function in Germany. Your mission: unlock untapped growth potential by defining and implementing a structured, scalable marketing approach in close collaboration with national enterprise restaurant partners and Wolt‚Äôs account management and commercial teams. You‚Äôll shape how we work with strategic enterprise partners from a marketing perspective‚Äîaligning on shared business goals, delivering measurable impact through co-marketing initiatives, and creating long-term value through a repeatable and data-informed approach.

You will work with one more team member as a peer on Strategic Enterprise Partnerships Marketing to ensure strong operational execution, growth, and collaboration.

This role is central to Wolt Germany‚Äôs growth strategy and requires a balance of strategic thinking, cross-functional leadership, and hands-on campaign expertise.

Day-to-day in this role, you‚Äôll:

Strategic Leadership & Framework Development


Update, build, and lead Wolt‚Äôs marketing approach to strategic enterprise partnerships.
Define a scalable operating model, including goal-setting frameworks, partner segmentation, reporting, and co-marketing processes.
Identify and activate high-impact marketing opportunities that align with commercial strategy and partner priorities.


Campaign Development & Execution


With the wider local marketing team, develop and roll out full-funnel 360¬∞ campaigns across paid media, OOH, CRM, and in-app channels.
Create co-branded initiatives and promotional concepts tailored to partner goals and customer behavior.
Prioritize and manage budgets to maximize performance and ROI.


Cross-Functional & Partner Collaboration


Work closely with commercial, account management, and sales teams to align on partner strategies, timelines, and deliverables.
Build trusted relationships with senior marketing stakeholders on the partner side to shape and deliver joint marketing plans.
Provide internal enablement (e.g., toolkits, briefs, and guidance) to scale high-quality partner marketing across markets.


Brand, CRM & Customer Experience


Ensure that partner brand identity is well-represented and consistent within the Wolt app and across campaign assets.
Collaborate on CRM, co-branding, and cross-promotion initiatives to engage users and drive conversion.
Support messaging development and oversee execution across email, push, pop-ups, and incentive campaigns.


Insights, Reporting & Playbook Creation


Analyze campaign and channel performance to assess impact, improve outcomes, and optimize spend.
Deliver regular performance reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
Systematize learnings into playbooks that can be scaled across other strategic partnerships.


Our humble expectations


6+ years of marketing experience, with a strong focus on B2C and strategic partnership marketing within a platform, tech, or FMCG environment.
Proven success in working cross-functionally and building structured, scalable marketing programs.
Experience in managing stakeholders, with strong leadership and communication skills, internally and externally.
Expertise in paid media, CRM, promotional marketing, and co-branded campaign development.
Strategic, data-driven, and results-oriented mindset.
Fluent in both German and English (written and spoken) ‚Äì this is essential for working with our local partners and internal teams.


What we offer


Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
Flexible working hours & hybrid model
Dog-friendly office culture.


Next steps

If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, click below to apply and get the conversation started!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for:


Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional in an international environment
Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company


After submitting your application, our Talent Acquisition team will review your profile. If it looks like a good fit, you‚Äôll go through a few rounds of interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and stakeholders. The process is designed to be transparent, efficient, and give you a real feel for life at Wolt.

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

title: Regional Restaurant Marketing Specialist
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we‚Äôre building the delivery of (almost) everything and you‚Äôll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn‚Äôt always easy, but it‚Äôs definitely exciting. Here you‚Äôll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You‚Äôll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you‚Äôre a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Wolt is one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing tech companies, on a mission to make cities better places to live by building a platform that connects people with the best of their neighborhoods‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs food, groceries, or retail. Operating in over 25 countries, Wolt‚Äôs success is driven by a deep focus on customer experience, local relevance, and a culture that empowers people to take ownership and make an impact.

In Germany, our marketing team is made up of talented, passionate and impact-driven professionals working across brand, growth, retention, and partnerships marketing.

This role, Regional Restaurant Marketing Specialist, offers a unique opportunity to shape Wolt‚Äôs restaurant marketing strategy across West, South, and Central Germany. With a strong focus on local market insight and partner collaboration, you‚Äôll develop tailored marketing plans that drive visibility and growth for our key restaurant partners in cities such as Cologne, D√ºsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, and Stuttgart.

What you‚Äôll be doing

Location: Berlin HQ (with regular travel to West, South and Central Germany) or alternative Location: Munich or Cologne office, with regular visits to Berlin HQ

As a Regional Marketing Specialist for Restaurants, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strengthening Wolt‚Äôs brand and commercial success by building impactful, on-the-ground restaurant marketing strategies tailored to the gastronomy scene in West, South and Central Germany. Your focus will be on activating our key SMB Restaurant Partners in cities like Cologne, D√ºsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, Stuttgart and beyond - bringing them visibility, growth, and customer engagement on the Wolt platform.

This is a unique, hybrid role combining strategic marketing skills with a hands-on, partner-facing approach, ideally suited for someone who thrives at the intersection of local food culture, creative marketing, and commercial collaboration.

Day-to-day in this role, you‚Äôll:

Local Market Strategy & Partner Activation


Develop and execute tailored restaurant marketing strategies across cities in West, South and Central Germany, based on your local market expertise.
Identify and capitalize on hyper-local marketing opportunities (e.g. city festivals, seasonal events, cultural moments).
Build and leverage existing relationships with top-tier restaurant partners in the region to co-create exciting marketing activations.


Hands-On Campaign Execution


Activate restaurant partners through on-the-ground support - from campaign planning to execution - to drive customer demand and visibility.
Execute 360 marketing plans, including advertising across various channels (paid, owned, earned), promotions, and co-branded initiatives.
Collaborate closely with the local Berlin-based Marketing team and our agencies to adapt national strategies into localized initiatives.
Manage regional/ partner marketing budgets, ensuring efficient resource allocation and adherence to financial targets.


Partner Relationship Management


Act as a trusted marketing advisor to key restaurant partners, helping them understand and use Wolt‚Äôs marketing tools effectively.
Closely collaborate with account management and local sales teams to align on priorities, performance goals, and joint marketing opportunities.


Performance Reporting, Data Analysis & Insights:


Track, analyze, optimize and report on marketing performance metrics at the regional and partner level.
Use data-based insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve return on investment (ROI).
Provide feedback from the field to continuously improve and shape local marketing strategies.


Our humble expectations


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, with 4-6 years of marketing experience and a proven track record in campaign execution and partner collaboration.
Strong ties to the gastronomy scene in West and/ or South and Central Germany are definitely a plus - whether through previous roles in food-tech, hospitality, FMCG, or lifestyle/urban marketing.
Strategic thinking and results-oriented mindset.
Hands-on attitude: You are comfortable rolling up your sleeves and moving from strategy to execution‚Äîwhether coordinating a photo shoot at a restaurant, setting up a pop-up activation, or meeting partners face-to-face to bring a campaign to life.
Bonus: Previous experience in sales or account management is a strong plus.
Native German speaking & business fluent in English
Compliance awareness and adaptability in a dynamic marketing landscape.
Willingness to travel regularly between Berlin and key cities in West, South and Central Germany.


What we offer


Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
Flexible working hours & hybrid model
Dog-friendly office culture.


Next steps

If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, click below to apply and get the conversation started!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for:


Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional in an international environment
Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company


After submitting your application, our Talent Acquisition team will review your profile. If it looks like a good fit, you‚Äôll go through a few rounds of interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and stakeholders. The process is designed to be transparent, efficient, and give you a real feel for life at Wolt.

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Marketing Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2024 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world‚Äôs most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

Job Description

We‚Äôre looking for a proactive and organized Marketing Manager (m/f/d) to lead the execution of our marketing strategy in the German market. You‚Äôll be responsible for turning business goals into customer-facing initiatives, coordinating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring our campaigns land effectively‚Äîboth online and offline.

Role

You‚Äôll report directly to the Marketing Lead and play a central role in planning, executing, and optimizing marketing activities that move the needle. As part of your role you will:


Own the marketing calendar: Build and manage it in close alignment with commercial, brand, CRM, performance, and operations teams.
Drive impactful campaigns: Translate business and seasonal priorities into successful 360¬∞ campaigns across owned and paid media.
Lead local execution: Coordinate assets and rollouts across CRM, app, offline, and performance to ensure a consistent, high-quality brand experience.
Boost visibility & local impact: Identify brand visibility opportunities and lead on-the-ground initiatives in key cities to grow awareness and reach.
Collaborate and optimize: Work cross-functionally to bring campaigns to life, support market expansions, and continuously improve based on data and KPIs.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in marketing roles, ideally in consumer goods, retail, or digital services
Native-level German and fluent English
Experience planning and executing 360¬∞ campaigns, including offline marketing
Strong project management skills‚Äîyou keep timelines, people, and priorities in check
Excellent cross-functional communication skills and stakeholder management
A doer mentality. You‚Äôre hands-on, pragmatic, and solution-oriented


Bonus Points


Experience in food, grocery, lifestyle, or e-commerce
Familiarity with tools like Jira, Braze, Notifly, Looker


Additional Information


A ‚Ç¨1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 35 EUR per month for Deutschland Ticket subsidy
A discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance

Requirements

Who You Are

Benefits

  • Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr die Familienstartzeit f√ºr Partner und Partnerinnen bei Geburt oder Adoption


Als eines der gr√∂√üten Modeunternehmen der Welt ist Vielfalt eine der wichtigsten S√§ulen unserer Unternehmenskultur. Bei uns arbeiten Menschen aus 174 Nationen, wir setzen uns f√ºr Chancengleichheit der Geschlechter ein und f√∂rdern LGBTIQ+ Pride auf beruflicher wie auch pers√∂nlicher Ebene. Die Inklusion von Menschen mit einer Beeintr√§chtigung entspricht unserem Selbstverst√§ndnis und wir freuen uns, Dir flexibel entgegenzukommen.


Bewirb Dich jetzt online und zeig uns, wer Du bist!

Wir freuen uns darauf, mehr √ºber Dich und Deine Talente zu erfahren.


SHARE YOUR TALENT!

title: Social Media Manager W/M/D
description:
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery‚Ä¶ the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are‚Ä¶

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD‚Äôs vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what‚Äôs next‚Ä¶

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Your New Role

The Social Media team is on a mission to drive connection with our passionate audiences and brand defining moments that shake you, move you, and stay with you.

The team is part of the Brand and Content Marketing team in EMEA, and you will collaborate closely within the team to grow brand and content love across local social channels. You will be the Social Media Manager for Germany and our leading expert in the areas of: Original Productions (Germany), German social audiences, Local content creators & events. You will also take a role in driving moments of brand love across EMEA.

Your mission is to launch HBO Max in Germany, build a strong, engaged follower base, and drive brand awareness and love. As German social lead, you will own, create and implement the local brand strategy and work towards the perfect split between local content and global IPs represented in our communities.

As Manager of Local Productions (DE), you lead the strategy, creative execution, and campaign rollouts to drive maximum social impact for HBO Max' local content. With a sharp eye for local trends and audience insights, you craft distinct, high-performing campaigns in close collaboration with regional stakeholders, activating industry tastemakers on social and curating content creators.

A

s Social Manager in Germany, you lead the launch and daily management of local social handles, creating organic and editorial content that reflects and celebrates community diversity. You stay plugged into local trends, collaborate with partners on events and campaigns, and drive visibility and performance. You own market localization, from crafting tailored copy to ensuring high-quality ideas, captions, and visuals that resonate - and manage vibrant community communications, partnering with CX for best-in-class engagement and crisis response.

Your Role Accountabilities


Launching the HBO Max streaming service in Germany and all relevant social handles.
Leading local campaigns on German Original Productions ensuring creative & innovative campaigns from first brainstorm to final report on high-tentpole level in collaboration with the local German team, briefing internal creative teams and agencies when relevant.
You work with the social Performance team for optimal performance, relevant reporting, audience analysis, and collaboration w/relevant partners.
You drive engagement and awareness through a mix of creative, innovative ideas & formats, and tried-and-tested best practices, and work to elevate German productions across EMEA where relevant.
As the local lead in Germany, you own the local strategy for content creators (campaign based + always-on), cover local events on social and initiate impactful collaborations with local talent.


As part of the Brand & Content Social Streaming team, your areas of responsibility also include:


Managing and owning your local Social Media handles strategy
Creating, planning, managing, executing, and evaluating pan-European organic social media campaigns focused on engagement, retention, non-standard activations, and community building.
Leading social media campaign development for global originals, Sport and other key brand initiatives.
Creating tailored, out-of-the-box content in collaboration with our in-house design team.
Working creatively with the content of the service to build awareness, drive engagement, and conversation on social media.
Owning the daily interaction with our fans, working with the CX team, ensuring they‚Äôre informed, engaged, and following our tone-of-voice.
Monitoring and reporting on local audience sentiments and trends.
Staying on top of social media creative trends and ensuring top level social media marketing campaigns locally and on a pan-European level.


Skills And Experience Required


+3 years‚Äô experience in social media/marketing brand and/or content
Flexible mindset, ready to adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment.
Great understanding for and experience working with fan communities.
Great knowledge and understanding of our brand and content - and its values.
Skills in project and budget management.
A self-sufficient and proactive approach to their work.
Strong skills in creative ideation & copywriting.
Strong campaign management skills and experience in campaign planning.
Fluency in written and spoken German & English. Great communication skills and relationship management.
A genuine, enthusiastic, and passionate fan of pop culture and new trends with knowledge and excitement for our content and product.


How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

Championing Inclusion at WBD

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law. Severely disabled employees are welcome in our company and will be given special consideration if they are equally qualified. Flexible working hours are offered to assist.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Your mission

Cariqa is here to make EV charging work - faster, safer and completely transparent. We‚Äôve built an omnichannel platform that gives Charge Point Operators total control: control pricing, get paid directly, and reach drivers however they want to pay. No markups. No middlemen. Just a transparent platform that helps clean transport scale. We‚Äôre not tweaking the old model. We‚Äôre replacing it.

We‚Äôre backed by leading investors in both climate and fintech - supporting our mission to bring direct, fair, and transparent payments to EV charging.We‚Äôre now actively growing our team. If you want to be part of this journey, apply now. And one day, when you plug in your EV and see a fair price at the charge point, you‚Äôll know you helped make that happen.

Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for a highly motivated, entrepreneurial marketing rockstar to build Cariqa‚Äôs marketing function from the ground up. Reporting to the Co-founder and CEO, you‚Äôll define and execute strategies that generate awareness, excitement, and trust among Charge Point Operators (CPOs) and other key players in the EV ecosystem across Europe.

This is a hands-on, entrepreneurial role where you‚Äôll define and drive our marketing strategy, create the core content and assets we need to scale, and launch campaigns that directly fuel sales and product growth. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with the commercial team to power our pipeline, with the product team to turn features into clear customer value, and with leadership to position Cariqa as the most credible and trusted solution in EV charging.

At Cariqa, our goal is to build a best-in-class platform that transforms the EV charging industry on a global scale. If you're a fast-moving, self-motivated, and goal-oriented marketer looking for a once-in-a-generation opportunity to build a marketing function from scratch, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Your Responsibilities


Develop and maintain Cariqa‚Äôs positioning, messaging, and tone of voice
Plan and run campaigns to support lead generation, product launches, and CPO acquisition
Create content such as case studies, website copy, pitch decks, and newsletters
Support the sales team with collateral for outreach, events, and follow-ups
Manage our LinkedIn presence and other relevant channels
Monitor performance and optimize based on data and feedback
Gather insights from customers and competitors to inform marketing decisions


Why us?


Play a key role in scaling the platform that‚Äôs simplifying and improving EV charging across Europe
Work at the intersection of fintech and climate ‚Äî combining the speed and innovation of fintech with the long-term impact of building a cleaner, fairer energy future
Join a focused and experienced team working across commercial, product and operations ‚Äî building fast and with purpose
Competitive salary and equity package, with real ownership and the chance to grow with the company
Flexible hybrid setup with our Berlin HQ as your base
30 days paid vacation, benefit allowance, and a culture that values clarity and autonomy


About Us

Cariqa is the first end-to-end payment billing and pricing platform built for EV charging. Designed for charge point operators, the platform reduces cost, simplifies operations, and delivers consistent pricing across all customer channels - driving trust, efficiency and adoption across the EV ecosystem. Cariqa is headquartered in Berlin, with operations across Europe.

title: Category Manager- Food & Beverage
description_html:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the purchase and sales of the categories involved, responsible for the gross profit margin and GMV of the categories involved;
  • Sales planning: Participate in but not limited to formulating sales business planning, developing and planning all aspects of the procurement business;
  • Procurement negotiations: responsible for finding and contacting partners, introducing commodities, participating in negotiations, controlling prices and reducing costs, checking fees, and maintaining information;
  • Product selection: Responsible for the product selection of the categories under its jurisdiction, selecting the appropriate products according to different scenarios;
  • Resource coordination: Responsible for coordination and communication with overseas supply chains, striving for support resources;
  • Data analysis: Responsible for analyzing sales and purchase data of the categories under its jurisdiction, proposing optimization plans and improving gross profit margin.


Qualifications:

  • 3+ years or above working experience in local Food & Beverage purchasing and sales, with experience in E-commerce is preferred;
  • Familiar with the local Food & Beverage category, with excellent first-hand market information and purchasing capabilities;
  • Strong logical thinking ability, data sensitive, continuous learning ability and excellent communication ability;
  • Full of passion and innovative spirit, willing to contribute to the team, mainly based on company interests and team interests.

title: Client Solutions Manager - Beauty & Healthcare - Berlin
description:
Responsibilities
The Client Solutions team's mission is to establish and build scalable, healthy, long-term client relationships by solving direct clients' and agencies' challenges through scalable, best in class campaign services. Client Solution Managers have a holistic understanding of TikTok's ad products, the overall paid media landscape and how to build successful, integrated marketing campaigns that meet their clients' KPIs and needs. Client Solution Managers should be able to identify opportunities and gaps in a clients' paid media strategy, with the ability to provide strategic insights and consultation in order to upsell and scale paid media spending on the platform. You are joining a team of strategic consultants, marketing & self-service platform experts, who proactively drive the clients' growth strategies, including upsells, renewals and campaign reactivations.

In this role, you will be working closely with the Brand and Agency Partnerships teams to deliver first-class service to clients in order to build a long-term, strategic partnership. We are looking for self-motivated and humble individuals who thrive in a dynamic, ever-changing environment, while being able to navigate ambiguity with ease. Success in this position requires a focus on client service, strategic & creative thinking, and the ability to provide custom solutions for advertisers leveraging our unique ad product suite, with a unique blend of technical expertise and commercial knowledge.

Responsibilities
- Analyze campaign performance data to offer clients data-driven business insights and, at the same time, use those insights to improve our advertising offerings, maximise client's revenue and increase ROI and efficiency
- Serve as a product consultant educating clients and agencies on product solutions and best practices, and ultimately helping to grow existing businesses, helping the team manage relationships with key Beauty & Healthcare clients and agency partners (media, creative, and marketing partners)
- Conduct regular business reviews and take a consultative, long-term approach to build strategic partnerships with clients, in collaboration with your Brand Partnership Manager
- Collaborate with diverse cross-functional teams to develop custom solutions or programs that meet clients' needs, and project manage custom campaigns to ensure assets are distributed and delivered on time
- Kick-off campaigns with clients and manage all timelines, assets and opportunities for optimization with data driven analysis
- Identify, create, and implement creative ad solutions grounded on achieving measurable business results for client partners
- Investigate and work directly with international product & engineering teams to help them troubleshoot client issues during a campaign
- Build scalable processes for our growing Client Solutions Management Team
- Work with the campaign execution team to ensure ad specifications are accurate as well as being responsible for the reporting of and optimisation of campaigns

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- 5+ years of experience in client solutions, account management or digital advertising
- Demonstrated experience and hands-on campaign management, across digital platforms and advertising tech products
- Deep understanding of the digital landscape and a passion for social media
- Detail oriented, data-driven, and analytical mindset with exceptional organisational & project management skills
- Proven track record of planning, executing & optimizing paid media campaigns and managing a complex book of business with revenue goals
- Excellent verbal and written English (mandatory) & German (preferred) communication skills, in order to communicate with clients
- Self-starter, fast learner with a start-up spirit, able to thrive in ever-changing & dynamic environments
- Ability to manage multiple priorities, timelines and tasks efficiently and execute at a high level

Preferred Qualifications:
- Background/experiences in performance and branding campaigns in an agency or on brand side
- Proven success working in a highly dynamic, rapidly changing environment
- Fluency in German is preferred but not mandatory
- Experience working with clients in the beauty & healthcare industry, CPG / FMCG

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.‚Äã


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

- Investigate and work directly with international product & engineering teams to help them troubleshoot client issues during a campaign
- Build scalable processes for our growing Client Solutions Management Team
- Work with the campaign execution team to ensure ad specifications are accurate as well as being responsible for the reporting of and optimisation of campaigns

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- 5+ years of experience in client solutions, account management or digital advertising
- Demonstrated experience and hands-on campaign management, across digital platforms and advertising tech products
- Deep understanding of the digital landscape and a passion for social media
- Detail oriented, data-driven, and analytical mindset with exceptional organisational & project management skills
- Proven track record of planning, executing & optimizing paid media campaigns and managing a complex book of business with revenue goals
- Excellent verbal and written English (mandatory) & German (preferred) communication skills, in order to communicate with clients
- Self-starter, fast learner with a start-up spirit, able to thrive in ever-changing & dynamic environments
- Ability to manage multiple priorities, timelines and tasks efficiently and execute at a high level

Preferred Qualifications:
- Background/experiences in performance and branding campaigns in an agency or on brand side
- Proven success working in a highly dynamic, rapidly changing environment
- Fluency in German is preferred but not mandatory
- Experience working with clients in the beauty & healthcare industry, CPG / FMCG

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.‚Äã


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.‚Äã
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.‚Äã
‚Äã
Diversity & Inclusion‚Äã
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.‚Äã

title: Assistant Store Manager - Munich, Germany
description:
Jimmy Choo







Assistant Manager, Boutique




About working for Jimmy Choo:




Jimmy Choo is a leading global luxury brand with an empowered sense of glamour and a playful daring spirit. Jimmy Choo products represent fine Italian craftsmanship and are famous for their quality and detail. Jimmy Choo has a global store network encompassing more than 200 stores worldwide.







Full-time




What you‚Äôll do:

As an Assistant Manager, you will

Engage and inspire the team by ensuring they are striving to reach targets and KPIs.
Support the Store Manager in ensuring that the team is providing exceptional standards of customer service.
Ensure the efficient running of the boutique following directives and procedures as set by Retail Excellence and the Company.
Provide a consistent example of the glamorous, luxury lifestyle image of Jimmy Choo through customer relationship management, attitude, personal grooming, dress code, and behaviour to the team and ensure that they also reflect this.
Assist the Store Manager in producing training to the team.
Support the Store Manager in monitoring staff performance and development
Support with stock takes.
Ensure that the merchandise presentation reflects the visual merchandising standards and general tidiness of the boutique are maintained at all times.
In the absence of a Store Manager, manage the day-to-day operations of the boutique







We‚Äôd love to see:

You‚Äôll be enthusiastic and self-motivated and has the ability to go the extra mile to achieve targets at all times.

You will have demonstrable success gained as a Manager with sound knowledge of the luxury market, customer service, and fashion.







Our values: creative, courageous, and passionate

Equality, diversity, and inclusion:

At Jimmy Choo, we are committed to building a representative business that is empowered by our celebration of difference and enriches our creative solution. We are all responsible for creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We try to inspire change and growth within each other and believe success is a result that comes from our difference. Jimmy Choo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusivity.




Jimmy Choo Perks

30 days of holidays
Products allowance and discount
Birthday day off
Exclusive employee sales




If you want to become a part of the Jimmy Choo family, we‚Äôd love to hear from you ‚Äì Apply today!

title: Creative Director
description:
We are a technology-led healthcare solutions provider. We are driven by our purpose to enable healthcare organizations to be future-ready. We offer accelerated, global growth opportunities for talent that‚Äôs bold, industrious, and nimble. With Indegene, you gain a unique career experience that celebrates entrepreneurship and is guided by passion, innovation, collaboration, and empathy. To explore exciting opportunities at the convergence of healthcare and technology, check out www.careers.indegene.com Looking to jump-start your career?

We understand how important the first few years of your career are, which create the foundation of your entire professional journey. At Indegene, we promise you a differentiated career experience. You will not only work at the exciting intersection of healthcare and technology but also will be mentored by some of the most brilliant minds in the industry.

We are offering a global fast-track career where you can grow along with Indegene‚Äôs high-speed growth. We are purpose-driven. We enable healthcare organizations to be future ready and our customer obsession is our driving force. We ensure that our customers achieve what they truly want. We are bold in our actions, nimble in our decision-making, and industrious in the way we work.




Creative Direction Manager will not only have command of agency services but also inÔ¨Çuence over strategic and creative recommendations and client-side decision-making by being seen as the ‚Äúagency lead‚Äù for their assigned brand:
Account lead - Owns several brands or one large brand
An expert in brand and all aspects of a client‚Äôs business, being able to speak to the category, across channels/audiences, etc. ‚Äì and to the larger internal teams
Oversees account(s) totaling $4-10M+ in agency fee
Presence ‚Äì Authoritative (informed) and strategic mindset when meeting with the team, agency leaders, or clients
Masterful communicator with a combination of listening, speaking, and business writing skills; knows when to pick up the phone, when to be at the client, when to email
Ability to identify cautionary client/project concerns that warrant proactive agency solutions and escalate to senior agency leadership
Relationship Building:
Trust and personal equity with all cross-functional team members to be able to rally them when needed to address client needs
Regularly works with strategy and creative to provide clear and proactive POVs on brand milestones, competitors, or market events
External ‚Äì Recognized as the leading voice in clients‚Äô mind
Considers broader ways to ‚Äúget a seat at the table‚Äù by developing relationships with extended client team and client vendors (e.g., research team, sales training, medical, etc.)
Fosters collaboration for innovative client solutions, always looking for ways to better serve the client, to grow their business
Manages up with a clear narrative for the account overall; mentors junior staÔ¨Ä to improve their performance

Operational ProÔ¨Åciency:

Brand oversight - Accountable to all aspects of projects within assigned brand; and ensuring strategic rationale and creative vision
Ensures team members are delivering quality deliverables
Manage team through the development of strategic project briefs and ensures client agreement to all assumptions
Review all deliverables to meet quality standards and client expectations
Manage cross-functional teams to ensure an organized delivery of eÔ¨Äective and engaging creative reviews of assets
EÔ¨Äectively activates the right people at the right time to connect and drive forward key client/brand workstreams
Financial Stewardship:
Manage total budget by having proactive, ongoing conversations with project management team and clients/VP to meet revenue goals
Final reviewer/approver of all project estimates, SOWs and Ô¨Ånance trackers to ensure accuracy
Accountable to monthly forecasts provided to leadership and transparently address issues that may impact budgets
Responsible for leading Phasing & Utilization process internally; able to communicate a clear and coherent narrative to explain budget phasing changes/implications
Ability to identify and pull-forward tactics to support staÔ¨Ä utilization and meet projected forecast as needed




Other Skillsets:

Looks for ways to integrate workstreams, to establish rapport, best practices and demonstrate their commitment to team
Spearheads brand planning process with strategy and creative to deliver the most innovative ideas possible and solidify role as a strong partner
Can have ‚Äòtough‚Äô conversations internally and with clients, but handles them with professionalism and dignity to build further trust
IdentiÔ¨Åes opportunities for live interactions as much as possible, focusing on ensure the best possible client experience




EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

Indegene is proud to be an Equal Employment Employer and is committed to the culture of Inclusion and Diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sex, colour, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical ability, or any other characteristics. All employment decisions, from hiring to separation, will be based on business requirements, the candidate‚Äôs merit and qualification. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristics.

title: Entrepreneur in Residence (m/f/x)
description:
We're looking for an ambitious, hands-on Entrepreneur in Residence (EiR) to help us discover, validate, and build new ventures from scratch. You'll work closely with our CEO to turn early-stage ideas into validated MVPs ‚Äî through customer interviews, fast iterations, and market exploration.

If you love building from zero within a thriving start-up in climate tech, this role is for you.

Key Responsibilities üéØ


Validate new venture opportunities: You lead deep-dive market research and customer discovery to uncover pain points and white spaces
Build and test MVPs: You move fast from hypothesis to prototype, using low-code tools, mockups, and customer feedback to validate what works
Own pilot initiatives: You help set up and run early-stage pilots, translating insights into real-world traction and learnings
Drive customer-facing outreach: You initiate and manage cold outreach (calls, emails, lead funnels) to generate qualitative insights and interest
Create clarity from ambiguity: You develop clear slide decks and narratives to communicate opportunity areas internally and externally


This role is right for you if... ‚ú®


You think and act like a founder ‚Äî grit, ownership, and speed are second nature to you
You love talking to customers, exploring unfamiliar terrain, and turning insight into execution
You're structured in your thinking, clear in your communication, and hands-on in your approach
You thrive in ambiguity and see chaos as a creative opportunity
You're motivated by solving real-world problems and making a positive impact on the climate


Requirements

Skills & experience you will need üí™


Bachelor's degree, ideally in a field related to entrepreneurship, innovation, or tech ‚Äî and a strong drive to build things that matter
You've built something before ‚Äî ideally a company, MVP, or product (success or failure both welcome)
Strong analytical thinking and hypothesis testing mindset
Solid communication skills, especially in slide decks and user interviews
Self-starter with the ability to lead an initiative from scratch
Fluent in German and English


Benefits


Remote Working: Work from our hubs in Hamburg or Munich, or remote from Germany
Unlimited Vacation: Take as many holidays as you need ‚Äî we trust you to recharge when it matters most
Flexible Working Hours: Work during the hours that align with your peak performance and lifestyle
Mental Health Matters: Access 1:1 psychologist sessions and workshops through our Bloom partnership
Professional Growth: Use a dedicated development budget to enhance your skills and career
Stock Option Plan: Receive virtual stocks as a reward for your trust, effort, and vision alignment
Unite, Recharge, Celebrate: Join in-person team retreats to connect and have fun
Explore Germany: Enjoy the Deutschlandticket for flexible public transportation access

title: Content & Social Media Creator (m/f/d) Berlin Based
description:
About The Company

Tomorrow University: A Next-Generation University for Impactful Careers

Education is the most powerful lever for driving the transition to a sustainable society. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve built a university dedicated to educating and empowering the change-makers of tomorrow. We offer accredited degree programs designed to equip learners with 21st-century competencies while providing access to a world-class network of experts to maximize their impact.

As a remote-first institution, we use technology and AI to enable flexible, personalized learning - accessible from anywhere in the world.

We are proud to be the first EdTech startup in Europe with a fully state-recognized university license and to be ranked among the Top 20 EdTech startups globally.

Our Inspiration

We believe that transforming education requires rethinking how we teach. At Tomorrow University, we move beyond the traditional, teacher-centered approach and embrace a student-centric learning model. Our goal is to equip learners with the essential skills and mindset needed to create global impact, supported by a vast network of change-makers.

Our Mission

At Tomorrow University, we leverage science and technology to enhance learning while fostering a global community for continuous growth and impact. Our students learn by applying their knowledge to real-world challenges and engaging with world-class educators, mentors, and partners from around the globe.

Be aware that all of our positions are completely Remote but our working hours are Central European Time (+/- 2h)

About The Role

Please note that this position is based in Berlin, with flexible home office/remote work options.

As a Content & Social Media Creator at Tomorrow University, you will be responsible for managing our Social Media channels & content and empowering our community to become influential voices on Social Media. Your role is crucial in taking our community to the next level.

Your Main Tasks Will Include


üì¢ Manage our LinkedIn Founder Accounts ‚Äì Manage the profiles and the content for them.
üåüBuild Personal Branding Programs Setup and Develop Personal Branding Programs for our community to make them strong voices.
‚úçÔ∏è Create Educational Content ‚Äì Create infographics, visuals, and carousels that educate our community on our key topics.
ü§ùLeverage Existing Content - Coordinate the team to get the most out of the Content we‚Äôve created and repurpose on other channels.
üìä Analyze and Optimize ‚Äì Track the performance of our channels and content, create reports üìà, and improve continuously.
üöÄ Innovate ‚Äì Evolve our social media communication to boost our online presence and reputation based on the latest trends.


What We Are Looking For


üíº 2-3 Years in (Educational) Content Creation ‚Äì Experience in startups is a plus.
üì± Strong Personal Social Media Presence ‚Äì Especially on LinkedIn in the last 12+ months.
üåç Fluency in BOTH German and English ‚Äì Spoken and written
üîç Data-Driven ‚Äì Expert in analyzing KPIs and using tools to optimize performance.
üé® Creative Mind ‚Äì Proficient with tools like Canva to create stunning visuals.
‚ö° Dynamic and Adaptable ‚Äì Thrives in fast-paced environments with changing priorities.
üìç Berlin-based ‚Äì While we work remotely, this role requires being based in Berlin to join local team activities and in-person sessions.


What Matters To Us

We‚Äôre looking for people who thrive in a dynamic, mission-driven environment. These traits are especially important to us:


Ownership & Independence ‚Äì You take initiative and get things done
Collaborative Mindset ‚Äì You enjoy working across teams and disciplines
Clear & Thoughtful Communication ‚Äì You know how to adapt your message to different audiences
Integrity, Curiosity & Growth ‚Äì You‚Äôre honest, open-minded, and always looking to learn
Proactivity & Drive ‚Äì You bring energy and momentum to your work
Commitment to Execution ‚Äì You don‚Äôt just dream big‚Äîyou make things happen
Passion for Sustainability, Entrepreneurship & Technology ‚Äì You care deeply about building a better future


Perks & Benefits

üöÄ Work from anywhere, anytime

Our flexible work culture gives you the freedom to design your day. Need a change of scenery? We offer a co-working space budget so you can connect and collaborate wherever you are.

üå± Grow with us

At Tomorrow University, we foster lifelong learning. You‚Äôll have access to our innovative programs and be part of a culture that encourages continuous growth‚Äîpersonally and professionally.

üåç Travel the world together

Twice a year, we bring the whole team together for a week-long Workation somewhere in Europe‚Äîthink bonding, brainstorming, and big ideas in beautiful places.

üå¥ Time to recharge

You‚Äôll get 25 vacation days per year, plus public holidays based on your location.

Ready to shape the future of education and make an impact? Join us and help reimagine how we learn, grow, and build a better tomorrow.

At Tomorrow University, we believe in your potential, not your paperwork. Degrees are great, but your drive matters even more üöÄ

description_html:
About The Company

Tomorrow University: A Next-Generation University for Impactful Careers

Education is the most powerful lever for driving the transition to a sustainable society. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve built a university dedicated to educating and empowering the change-makers of tomorrow. We offer accredited degree programs designed to equip learners with 21st-century competencies while providing access to a world-class network of experts to maximize their impact.

As a remote-first institution, we use technology and AI to enable flexible, personalized learning - accessible from anywhere in the world.

We are proud to be the first EdTech startup in Europe with a fully state-recognized university license and to be ranked among the Top 20 EdTech startups globally.

Our Inspiration

We believe that transforming education requires rethinking how we teach. At Tomorrow University, we move beyond the traditional, teacher-centered approach and embrace a student-centric learning model. Our goal is to equip learners with the essential skills and mindset needed to create global impact, supported by a vast network of change-makers.

Our Mission

At Tomorrow University, we leverage science and technology to enhance learning while fostering a global community for continuous growth and impact. Our students learn by applying their knowledge to real-world challenges and engaging with world-class educators, mentors, and partners from around the globe.

Be aware that all of our positions are completely Remote but our working hours are Central European Time (+/- 2h)

About The Role

Please note that this position is based in Berlin, with flexible home office/remote work options.

As a Content & Social Media Creator at Tomorrow University, you will be responsible for managing our Social Media channels & content and empowering our community to become influential voices on Social Media. Your role is crucial in taking our community to the next level.

  • üìä Analyze and Optimize ‚Äì Track the performance of our channels and content, create reports üìà, and improve continuously.
  • üöÄ Innovate ‚Äì Evolve our social media communication to boost our online presence and reputation based on the latest trends.

What Matters To Us

We‚Äôre looking for people who thrive in a dynamic, mission-driven environment. These traits are especially important to us:

  • Ownership & Independence ‚Äì You take initiative and get things done
  • Collaborative Mindset ‚Äì You enjoy working across teams and disciplines
  • Clear & Thoughtful Communication ‚Äì You know how to adapt your message to different audiences
  • Integrity, Curiosity & Growth ‚Äì You‚Äôre honest, open-minded, and always looking to learn
  • Proactivity & Drive ‚Äì You bring energy and momentum to your work
  • Commitment to Execution ‚Äì You don‚Äôt just dream big‚Äîyou make things happen
  • Passion for Sustainability, Entrepreneurship & Technology ‚Äì You care deeply about building a better future

Perks & Benefits

üöÄ Work from anywhere, anytime

Our flexible work culture gives you the freedom to design your day. Need a change of scenery? We offer a co-working space budget so you can connect and collaborate wherever you are.

At Tomorrow University, we foster lifelong learning. You‚Äôll have access to our innovative programs and be part of a culture that encourages continuous growth‚Äîpersonally and professionally.

title: Performance Marketing Manger
description:
Soda have partnered with a business who is operating a leading European platform for online lottery and prize-based gaming, offering customers the chance to win dream homes and other high-value rewards in a fun, secure, and regulated environment‚Äîall while supporting charitable causes!




They are now on the hunt for a talented Performance Marketing Manager to join the team!




Role: Performance Marketing Manager

Location: Hamburg (1x per month in office)

Salary: ‚Ç¨50,000‚Äì‚Ç¨65,000

Language: Must be C1 level of German or above




You'll work closely with our Performance Marketing Manager who brings the creative spark ‚Äî your job is to bring the analytical firepower, campaign hustle, and channel expertise to match it.




What you will be doing:

Run and optimize paid media campaigns (Google Ads a must; Reddit/Twitch a big plus)
Launch campaigns, adjust budgets, and update creatives
Monitor performance and report on key metrics
Test new channels, audiences, and creative angles
Collaborate with creative team to align messaging and visuals
Learn, adapt, iterate ‚Äî fast




What We're Looking For:

3‚Äì5 years of experience in paid performance marketing
Strong Google Ads experience ‚Äî you live in the dashboard
Comfortable with media buying, budget pacing, and performance tracking
Analytical mindset with a love for numbers and campaign testing
Startup-ready: comfortable with rapid changes, imperfect info, and taking initiative
A builder‚Äôs mindset ‚Äî not afraid to try, fail, learn, and scale
Bonus: experience with Reddit Ads, Twitch, TikTok, Meta




Don‚Äôt be shy- apply now!

title: Content Marketing Manager
description:
Tired of the 9-to-5 grind? Imagine a world without borders, where opportunities are endless. That's the future of work, and we're building it at WorkMotion. Our all-in-one HR platform makes it easy to hire and manage global teams, ensuring compliance and streamlining processes. So whether you're a digital nomad or a remote-first company, we've got you covered.

Ready to join the future of work? Let's build something amazing together. As we value work-life balance, please only apply if you're based within 2 hours of the Central European Timezone.

Our Marketing Team is looking for someone with high creative energy to drive our brand story and growth as a Content Marketing Manager. You will also be tasked with developing and implementing a comprehensive strategy for our content marketing and social media channels.¬†


Content Marketing Manager (English & German)

We're searching for a creative, strategic, and results-driven Content Marketing Manager who can turn complex ideas into content that captivates. If you're good at storytelling and strategy, love digging into data, and know what makes B2B content resonate and convert, this role is made for you.\


What you'll do:

Own the end-to-end content strategy for WorkMotion, including coming up with new ideas, maintaining content calendars and working cross functionally with multiple teams including Sales, Product and CS
Create well-researched, high-quality written content in both English and German: including but not limited to landing pages, articles, emails, guides, whitepapers, research reports, and more
Own our social media presence from strategy to execution. You'll craft posts that people actually want to read and engage with (primarily on LinkedIn, but also Facebook, Instagram, and others)
Strike the right balance between leveraging AI for efficiency and ensuring every piece of content feels authentic, human, and genuinely engaging
Understand and implement SEO best practices to make sure our content ranks and resonates
Manage multiple projects and collaborate with external partners like PR agencies, freelancers and video producers. You'll manage timelines, briefs, and reviews like a pro
Measure content performance to ensure it's not just high-quality but also generates leads and delivers value
Experiment with various formats like short-form videos, animations, or visual storytelling in collaboration with our Graphic Designer. You've got a strong eye for design and know how to brief creatives


What you bring:

3-4 years of experience in content marketing (B2B SaaS or HR tech experience is a plus)
A portfolio of content that educates, engages, and converts. You're proud of the work you've done, and you know what works
Native or fluent English and German skills (You'll write in both, though our primary language is English)
Experience managing content calendars, juggling multiple projects, and working cross-functionally
An interest in content analytics. You like to test, learn, and iterate
Basic knowledge of SEO, AI content tools, and a hunger to keep learning more
Highly motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision



Benefits and perks:

Global, remote, and thriving: We're a global team of talented individuals spread across 26 countries. Our WorkFlex program lets you work from anywhere, anytime. Whether it's a beachside office or a cosy home office, the choice is yours
Your well-being is our priority: We know mental health matters, which is why we offer a dedicated Well-Being Day‚Äîa full day off just to recharge and relax
Get fit and stay active: Whether it's yoga, weightlifting, or a quick jog‚Äîwork out on your terms, at a discount with our subsidised gym memberships
Learn, grow, and develop: We believe in constant growth. With our Training & Development Allowance, you'll have all the opportunities you need to keep expanding your skills and knowledge.
Stay connected: Take part in exciting annual team meetups!
Diversity is our superpower: We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.
Benefits vary depending on location due to local laws and regulations.


At WorkMotion, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you need any accommodations during the recruitment process, just let our Recruitment Team on Jobs@WorkMotion.com. We're here to support you every step of the way!

title: Senior Event Marketing Manager
description:
About You

You are a seasoned event marketing leader with deep experience managing trade shows and field events across EMEA. You thrive in complex, fast-moving environments, love solving problems, and excel at cross-functional collaboration. You are highly autonomous and thoughtful ‚Äî someone who doesn't just ask questions, but does the work to find answers, evaluate options, and present decision-ready insights to leadership. You balance independent execution with strong judgment, knowing when to ask for input and when to confidently move forward.

About Us

Constructor is the next-generation platform for search and discovery in ecommerce, built to explicitly optimize for metrics like revenue, conversion rate, and profit. Our search engine is entirely invented in-house utilizing transformers and generative LLMs, and we use its core and personalization capabilities to power everything from search itself to recommendations to shopping agents. Engineering is by far our largest department, and we've built our proprietary engine to be the best on the market, having never lost an A/B test to a competitive technology. We're passionate about maintaining this and work on the bleeding edge of AI to do so.

Out of necessity, our engine is built for extreme scale and powers over 1 billion queries every day across 150 languages and roughly 100 countries. It is used by some of the biggest ecommerce companies in the world like Sephora, Under Armour, and Petco.

We're a passionate team who love solving problems and want to make our customers' and coworkers' lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they do best can lead to great things.

Constructor is a U.S.-based company that has been in the market since 2019. It was founded by Eli Finkelshteyn and Dan McCormick who still lead the company today.

About The Position

We are looking for a Senior Event Marketing Manager (Contract) to lead Constructor's EMEA events while a full-time team member is on maternity leave. This is a senior-manager-level, fully remote, individual contributor role reporting to the Director of Global Events (based in Washington, D.C. / Eastern Time).

The contract runs from August 15, 2025 to April 15, 2026, structured to allow a 1-month onboarding period before the full-time team member begins maternity leave, followed by 6 months of leave coverage and a 1-month transition period upon their return.

This role requires approximately 30% travel across EMEA, primarily to events in Germany, the U.K., and Sweden - this includes multi-day travel to support on-site event execution.

This person will be responsible for independently planning and executing Constructor's presence at industry trade shows, conferences, and field events. You'll manage every aspect of the event lifecycle ‚Äî from strategy and vendor management to onsite execution and post-event lead follow-up ‚Äî while collaborating closely with our EMEA sales and SDR teams, and cross-functionally with the broader marketing team.

Although you'll work autonomously day-to-day, key decisions ‚Äî especially those involving budget, brand, and activations ‚Äî must be reviewed and approved by the Director of Global Events. You should be prepared to present research-backed recommendations to streamline decision-making and keep things moving.

Key Responsibilities

End-to-End Event Execution + Logistics


Lead all logistics for trade shows, conferences, and field various events across EMEA
Manage the exhibit booth vendor relationship to ensure all exhibitor deadlines are met and that booth logistics and services are thoroughly planned and executed ‚Äî including graphic submissions, AV and technical requirements, booth furnishings, internet, electrical, rigging, freight, lead retrieval, catering, and more
Oversee vendor relationships, contracts, and deliverables
Coordinate lead capture, export, and CRM handoff with RevOps and Marketing Ops
Research and evaluate activation opportunities; prepare clear pros/cons and logistics breakdowns for leadership approval
Coordinate internal logistics such as registration, hotel room blocks, travel recommendations, and attendee checklists; ensure all stakeholders complete required actions and deadlines are met


Sales & SDR Team Partnership


Serve as the main point of contact for the EMEA sales and SDR teams
Collaborate on event promotion strategies, persona-based messaging, and account targeting
Lead pre-event kickoff calls and "know before you go" briefings
Own all sales comms via Slack, ensuring clarity and alignment


Cross-Functional Collaboration


Work closely with internal partners across:
Demand Generation (for pre- and post-event promo)
Product Marketing (for messaging and positioning)
Marketing Ops (for SFDC + Hubspot campaigns and pre and post-event reporting)
Content & Design (for booth graphics and content promo)

Project Management


Own all documentation: event program briefs, staffing plans, timelines, attendee guides and various trackers
Maintain accurate budgets, submit invoices, and provide post-event ROI analysis
Use Asana to manage all event tasks, milestones, and dependencies


Judgment & Leadership


Operate independently but collaboratively ‚Äî know when to escalate for approval
Bring a problem-solving mindset: dig deep, cross-reference sources, and present decision-ready summaries


Respond to ambiguity with initiative, curiosity, and structure

Requirements


10+ years of experience in B2B event marketing and trade show management
Demonstrated success managing complex event programs across EMEA
Fluent in German (spoken and written) ‚Äî critical for local events and sales collaboration
Strong preference for candidates based in the U.K. or Germany
Deep knowledge of booth logistics, vendor negotiation, and event ops
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî especially over Slack, Asana, etc
Experience leading omni-channel marketing plans to promote company presence at industry trade shows and events (e.g. email, social, SDR outreach, digital ads)
Comfortable working across time zones (your manager is based on U.S. Eastern Time)
Proactive and resourceful ‚Äî not just task-oriented, but solution-oriented
Familiarity with Salesforce and marketing automation platforms (preferred) such as Hubspot
Extremely organized and detail-oriented, with impeccable project management skills and a proactive approach to building systems that improve efficiency, documentation, and cross-functional collaboration
Willing and able to travel up to 30% throughout Europe


Benefits

üèùÔ∏è Unlimited vacation time - we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year

üí∞ A competitive compensation package including stock options

üåé Fully remote team - choose where you live

üõãÔ∏è Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office

üíª Apple laptops provided for new employees

üßë‚Äçüéì Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year

üë™ Maternity & Paternity leave for qualified employees

üß† Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact

üè• Company-sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.
